page.title: 02PRINCIPAL MONUMENTS CHEADLE.
page.content: ST.MARYS, CHEADLE PARISH CHURCH IS SITUATED AT THE END OF THE HIGH STREET, AND IS A CHURCH OF ENGLAND,BUILT BETWEEN 152O AND 1556. BESIDES BEING A PLACE OF WORSHIP AND OF WEDDINGS, IT IS OF HISTORICAL INTEREST AND MANY OF THE GRAVE STONES BOTH IN THE CHURCH AND CHURCH YARD ARE OF LAND OWNERS AND IMPORTANT PEOPLE OF THE SURROUNDING DISTRICT. MANY MEMORIALS TO FAMILIES CONNECTED WITH THE CHURCH TOOK THE FORM OF STAINED GLASS WINDOWS WHICH WERE WHOLLY OR PARTLY DESTROYED BY 1660 AND LATER REPLACED. A FRAGMENT OF OLD GLASS REMAINS ON THE LEFT HAND SIDE OF THE EAST WINDOW. IT IS OF THE STANLEY COAT OF ARMS. AN ALABASTER EFFIGY OF SIR JOHN STANLEY IS INSIDE THE BRERETON CHAPEL ON THE LEFT HAND SIDE OF THE EAST WINDOW.
